item.title: Why using default_scope is a bad idea
item.description: default_scope is a method provided by ActiveRecord, which allows you to set a default scope (as its name implies) for all operations done on a given model. It can be useful for allowing soft-deletion in your models, by having a deleted_on column on your model and default scoping the model to deleted_on: nil.

item.title: Mercado Pago Security Hole
item.description: On April 17th we discovered a security vulnerability in the Mercado Pago API. Before disclosing this information, we contacted Mercado Libre and sent them a detailed report of the security hole and how to reproduce it.

item.title: The Lean Startup Way
item.description: At OmbuLabs we like to split our time working on our own products, client projects, and open source code. We have embraced the Lean Startup methodology not only for our own products but also for our client projects.

item.title: How to Git push with blocked ports
item.description: Often times I find myself working out of a coffee shop with a terrible Internet connection. We have a nice office at OmbuLabs but there is still that Je ne sais quoi at coffee shops.

item.title: Our Definition of "Done"
item.description: Quality should be present in everything you do, but it should be balanced with the time you spend working on a feature. Does it feel like you've been working on this feature for a really long time? Maybe you have. Is it "done"?

item.title: Enumerable#grep vs Enumerable#select
item.description: Often, Enumerable#select is the chosen method to obtain elements from an Array for a given block. Without thinking twice, we may be doing more work than necessary by not taking advantage of another method from the Enumerable module, Enumerable#grep.

item.title: 4 Useful Github tricks which should be more popular
item.description: If you are using git in 2015, you are probably also using Github, unless you're self-hosting or still betting on Bitbucket.
